page.title: 03 FARMING IN THE BRUTON AREA
page.content: Most of the land in this area is used for grazing dairy cattle.The area is hilly so there is not much corn grown and it is also very wet.Some sheep and beef cattle graze on the wasteland on the hills.There are some vineyards quite near Castle Cary,they are grown on sloping land.It covers a large area of land.The dairy cows are milked twice a day.In summer the cows are left out in the fields and brought in for milking when needed.They are milked early in the morning and early afternoon.In winter they are kept in barns and are fed on hay and silage.Crops are not grown very much because the land is hilly and on the hills,very wet.
